step0.title: Areas
step0.subtitle: The first thing you'll encounter in Pokrok are Areas. Areas reflect different parts of your life and in the app they primarily serve for easier viewing and filtering. You can add Habits, Goals, and Steps to Areas. Areas are intended as life areas - for example Career, finances, or health, but you can also use them for larger projects or your own view of different goals / steps / habits. When you're in an area and add a step, goal, or habit, it will automatically be assigned to that area.

step1.title: Create a goal
step1.subtitle: Goals are the largest building blocks of Pokrok. They are all the things you want to achieve that cannot be solved within a single session. You can create goals as needed and ideally use the SMART framework - making goals Specific, Measurable, Ambitious, Relevant, and Time-bound. For this, you can use Steps in Pokrok - for sub-parts, or habits - for repeated and measurable tasks.
step1.exampleDesc: I want to create my own web application

step2.title: Add steps
step2.subtitle: Steps can be used as To-Do items without any goal, but their primary purpose is to help break down Goals into smaller parts - ideally parts that can be done within one day. Completing steps then increases the goal's progress. If needed, a Step can be further broken down into individual checklist items in the step settings for better control.

step3.title: Build habits
step3.subtitle: The third fundamental building block is habits, which are actions that are repeatable and measurable. Habits can be set to Daily, weekly, monthly, or in custom intervals. Habits are not assigned to goals as such. Instead, I recommend creating a Step that specifies how many times, for example, I must complete the habit - (Meditation - 5x per week for one year).

focusHelp.stepsDescription: Steps are divided into three categories:

focusHelp.overdueStepsDescription: Overdue steps - steps that should have been completed earlier (red border)

focusHelp.timelineDescription: Clicking on a day in the timeline switches to the daily overview. In the daily overview, you'll see only steps and habits for the selected day. Clicking on the same day again returns to the weekly overview.
